questions.question: What is Matplotlib primarily used for?

explanations.a: Correct! Matplotlib is the most widely used Python library for creating data visualizations.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Machine learning libraries include scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Matplotlib does not clean data; it visualizes it.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Database management is handled by SQL, MongoDB, etc., not Matplotlib.

questions.question: Which feature makes Matplotlib suitable for professional, publication-ready graphics?

answers.a: It offers built-in machine learning models
answers.b: It can export high-resolution and vector format images

explanations.a: Incorrect. Matplotlib does not provide ML models.
explanations.b: Correct! Matplotlib allows exporting to formats such as PNG, PDF, SVG, and EPS.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Data cleaning is not part of Matplotlib.
explanations.d: Incorrect. It supports a wide range of plot types beyond basics.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a plot type supported by Matplotlib?

explanations.a: Line plots are fully supported in Matplotlib.
explanations.c: Heatmaps can be created using `imshow()` or other functions.
explanations.d: Correct. Web scraping is not related to data visualization or Matplotlib.

questions.question: Which of the following libraries directly uses Matplotlib as its backend for plotting?

explanations.a: Incorrect. NumPy is used for numerical operations, not plotting.
explanations.b: Correct! Pandas uses Matplotlib internally when calling `df.plot()`.
explanations.c: Incorrect. TensorFlow is a deep learning framework.
explanations.d: Incorrect. OpenCV is used for computer vision, not plotting.

questions.question: Which feature of Matplotlib allows creating multiple plots in a single figure?

explanations.a: Correct! `plt.subplots()`, `GridSpec`, and layout tools help create multiple plots in one figure.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Neural networks are unrelated to plotting.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Matplotlib does not clean data.

questions.question: Which statement best describes Matplotlib's customization capabilities?

answers.a: It offers very limited customization options
answers.b: It allows full control over all visual elements such as colors, fonts, markers, and grids
answers.c: It only supports default styles without modification
answers.d: It automatically chooses all design elements with no manual control

explanations.a: Incorrect. Matplotlib has extensive customization features.
explanations.b: Correct! Matplotlib gives complete control over every part of a visualization.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Users can modify any style element.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Matplotlib does not automate all design choices.
